comments: He mumbles very quietly, writing on board is tiny, messy, and not readable. tag_professor: Participation matters (3)  Inspirational (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Caring (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Tough Grader (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
comments: Only helpful if u show consistent effort. Go to his office hours every chance you get. Much more helpful there than in class. If he sees effort, ur grade might be "flexible". He will disappear the moment labs begin. Study on your own mainly, and do the ALL the practice problems, they will show up on tests. Midterms r 15 questions worth 10 pts each!

tag_professor: Participation matters (3)  Inspirational (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Caring (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Tough Grader (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
comments: Oh prof Ajie...he\'s not the most prepared (looks in the book 5 mins before class, just does examples) or the most clear (thick accent from Nigeria), but he just wants to see you try. I guarantee, go to office hours, do the labs, get a tutor, and he\'ll look the other way and give you a good grade. I had a 86 average, but still got an A. Nice!
